resources.string: You, come closer… your captain needs you. \n\nThere's something wrong. I'm not feeling right…
New face, old story. The wheel grinds on, grinds us down, doesn't it?
When time slips beneath death's grip once too often, such notions fade.\n\nOr they become tainted, whether by pain or corruption…

Are you still listening, ghost? Why bother? My words are wasted like bait lost from the hook.\n\nNo one listens to the Mad Wanderer… but Corruption WAS coming, IS coming, WILL come. No Soulwardens, this time.
I don't think I care for this... remembering things that want to stay forgotten.\n\nI searched for them, I did… but it was another time, a wasted time.
I remember it now… the final resting place of my friends, my pride, my responsibility.\n\nI outlasted them all, you see? I laid them to rest. It wasn't how it was supposed to end.
Becoming a soulwarden is not like joining a social club or even a military order.\n\nA soulwarden is not one who fights with their brawn, or with their wit… they fight with their soul.
For the next part of forging your staff, you must acquire one of our consecrated Crosspieces.\n\nIt will be tricky, however, as there are certainly none of these just lying about in an old cave.
Well done, {playerName}. You have the structural components for your Azoth Staff.\n\nNow, you need an element that's a little harder to come by.

string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar
string.comment: after "Old Foes Old Favors" but before "Return to Yonas"

resources.string: I remember that she was beautiful, and terrifying, and ancient, even when I was young…
While you were gone, I did a little scouting of the Corrupted encampments in this region.\n\nWhy this new wave of Corruption has hit Aeternum with such ferocity.
They say that's quite a boon here on Aeternum, though I think souls are a little over-rated.\n\nBut indeed, now that you have your staff, you can fight against the Corruption as you couldn't before.
Don't say I didn't warn you now, but you get used to it… sort of. \n\nThere is just one more thing you need before you can be anointed as a Soulwarden.
Hm. I should probably mention that there is another way to acquire a Heartgem.\n\nYou would need to forge it yourself, however, and the components may be tedious to track down.
A Soulwarden's power comes from creating distance in your soul, like a firebreak in the forest.\n\nThe Heartgem provides that barrier, inuring your soul against Corruption.
Once upon a time, the initiation of a new Soulwarden was cause to party for three days and nights. \n\nBut there's only two of us now. It would be a very subdued affair.
So you marched off, hoping to win the hearts, minds, and souls of the Covenant.\n\nI don't imagine they were too open-minded, were they?

The Corrupted are still coming south in huge numbers. I should send some Wardens to Great Cleave, establish a defensive line…\n\nMeanwhile, there's your faction parley. I'm still a bit skeptical about these…'Marauders'?

Whoever he was when you knew him, he's changed into something else now.

He certainly commands many Corrupted, and wields the power of the Tempest. 

And he is calling you out, by name.

There's good news and bad news. 

The good news is that we know where Thorpe is: the caverns under the old storm tower in Mourningdale. 

I imagine he's trying to claim its power for the Tempest. That could be bad.
To be honest with you, {playerName}, I never thought we'd get this far.\n\nI feared the Corruption had grown too powerful to be stopped. I think we actually have a chance now.
So, a shadow has come to visit. But shadows can't talk, we can't hear them. \n\nIsn't that right, fishies? That would be crazy.

string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar
string.comment: during the Covenant quests in act 2

resources.string: The Soulwardens need a headquarters. We can’t all live in this hut of mine. \n\nI seem to remember a place in the mountains, one that felt like home…

string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar
string.comment: during the Syndicate quests in act 2

resources.string: When you speak with the Syndicate, choose your arguments carefully. \n\nOne of them once told me that the thing separating “good” from “evil” was a sufficiently compelling argument.

string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar
string.comment: during the Marauders quests in act 2

resources.string: The Marauders are always holding contests of one sort or another.
You should not be in these parts, human.\n\nThis land is wounded, and it will not hesitate to deal with trespassers.
You are wasting your time and mine. \n\nWhat this land needs is fewer humans, time to heal…and a working azoth fountain. This one seems to be blocked.
You have done your part, so I will hear what you came here to say.\n\nBut I warn you - I have no sympathy for the plight of humans in the battle against Corruption. It is not our fight.

string.speaker: Adiana Theron
string.name: AdianaTheron
string.comment: leading into "And the Land Cries Out"

resources.string: Your sincerity has impressed me. That is the only reason we are still speaking.\n\nBut I think it will take more than sincerity to earn the trust of the Angry Earth.
There is nothing else for you right now. You should begone from here.\n\nBut… I do wish you good fortune in your future travels.
A great threat approached the island by sea… a box that contained a soul of great power.\n\nWhen the ship foundered, we seized the box and hid it away.
There are many cataclysms unfolding at once; we must deal with the closest first. \n\nThe Blight that came in the Tempest's wake still threatens this place.
Even if we were to consider such a thing, it's impossible. \n\nThe Motherwell's strength is what powers the Stormwall, the only thing preventing Corruption from spreading across the planet.
I see you have the Blighted spore bomb. Be very careful with it; the blast that kills the rot can also kill the root.
Much as I dislike this plan, the decision isn't mine to make. The Motherwell belongs to the Angry Earth. \n\nIf they agree to it, then so be it.
It's done. The Angry Earth is trusting in you. \n\nYou may enter the Motherwell, and… infect it.
Under our feet pulses a a combination of very volatile energies.\n\nThe power at your disposal is both unnatural and incredibly dangerous.

I've heard others call you a peacemaker, and now I've seen it with my own eyes. \n\nThe last of the Soulwardens, the human factions, the Angry Earth itself…never before have these forces joined under a single banner.
I can feel it… like a great weight from my shoulders. Like the sun on my face after a long storm. \n\nThe Tempest is gone from this world, and the Motherwell is safe, thanks to you.
Initiate Zhao, where is that casualty report? \n\nI am deeply sorry, but we are in something of a crisis here. Whatever your business, it will have to wait.

string.speaker: Emile d'Aquitane
string.name: Emile_d'Aquitane
string.comment: leading into "A Lost Cause" if not Covenant

resources.string: I do confess I have heard horror stories from Great Cleave - the Corrupted offensive and this… "Tempest".\n\nBut the balance between factions is precarious.

string.speaker: Emile d'Aquitane
string.name: Emile_d'Aquitane
string.comment: leading into "A Lost Cause" if Covenant

resources.string: I do confess I have heard horror stories from Great Cleave - the Corrupted offensive and this… "Tempest".\n\nBut you and I are Covenant, and the war between factions comes first, no?
Whether or not the Covenant would meet with the other factions is not a decision I can make, however.\n\nThat would be up to my superior, Adjudicator General Carvalho.
To be completely honest, my faith waivers at times. I see the Spark clearly in you however, {playerName}.\n\nYes, I think I would follow you into battle, any day.
I am earnest in my promise. \n\nI will be at the parley, and I will bring others.

string.speaker: Emile d'Aquitane
string.name: Emile_d'Aquitane
string.comment: leading into "A Heros Duty" and also after "Emiles Request" while still standing outside the cave

resources.string: I'm so glad that you, at least, are safe.
I swore that I would help you and Yonas defeat Corruption. I really believed we could do it. \n\nI've always been such a fool.
The legend said she and her lover had a falling out, and she killed him.\n\nAs revenge, his ghost came back and stole her evil soul. Put it in a box.
But if Captain Thorpe is no longer in possession of the box, who is?\n\nI need to consider this over a cup of mead. You should speak to Rima, did you see her?

string.speaker: Emile d'Aquitane
string.name: Emile_d'Aquitane
string.comment: if you talk to him at Mountainhome

resources.string: Good to see you again, {playerName}. I was right - the Soulwardens really needed my help up here. \n\nAnd your help. Any help they can get, really.

string.speaker: Emile d'Aquitane
string.name: Emile_d'Aquitane
string.comment: If you talk to him at the Restless Shore bar

resources.string: I found Dr. Theo wandering around outside. He's a bit odd, but his heart is in the right place!

string.speaker: Emile d'Aquitane
string.name: Emile_d'Aquitane
string.comment: in the Soulwarden camp, before its destruction

resources.string: Wow…I've heard legends about the Soulwardens since I was a boy. Not only are they real, but I get to fight alongside them! \n\nI feel like I'm part of history in the making.
I've decided to join the Soulwardens. The cause is just, and the people here have really made me feel at home. \n\nI feel like I finally found something worth fighting for.
What's that? A token of rememberance for Yonas? Let me think a moment.\n\nHere, take this, he would know why.
Can't talk yet. Must monitor the experiment, very volatile.\n\nMust watch the condensation…mustn't talk… mustn't... sleep…

string.speaker: Dr. Theo
string.name: DrTheo
string.comment: leading into "The Nose Knows" if not Syndicate

resources.string: But I don't mean to be rude, just thought you were delivering my alembics.\n\nLet me introduce myself - my parents named me Theophrastus Bombastus. They were otherwise good parents. But you can call me 'Doctor Theo'.

string.speaker: Dr. Theo
string.name: DrTheo
string.comment: leading into "The Nose Knows" if Syndicate

resources.string: But I don't mean to be rude to a fellow Syndicate member, especially.\n\nLet me introduce myself - my parents named me Theophrastus Bombastus. They were otherwise good parents. But you can call me 'Doctor Theo'.
With the bear threat eliminated, we can study the physio-botanical aspects of this region further.\n\nI have a theory, you see, about Corruption and the Angry Earth.
Do you realize the complete implications of this? That stormwall has been there for millennia!\n\nThe Angry Earth must sense that the Corruption represents a danger abroad, as well…
I can't stop thinking about our discoveries in Weaver's Fen. The Corruption, the Angry Earth, and the stormwall.\n\nBut what does this say about this so-called Blight?

string.speaker: Dr. Theo
string.name: DrTheo
string.comment: if you talk to him at the Restless Shore bar

resources.string:
Hello, {playerName}. The mead here is quite good, isn't it? I wonder what they put in it. 

Now if you'll excuse me, I'm pondering a problem...Corruption and the Angry Earth…Hmm… 

Perhaps I need more mead.

string.speaker: Dr. Theo
string.name: DrTheo
string.comment: in the Soulwarden camp, before its destruction

resources.string: How refreshing, to see the factions put aside their differences in pursuit of a greater goal. \n\nThink of what we could accomplish, if this were the norm…
A tiny part of me is sad that the Tempest was defeated before I got the chance to study it. \n\nBut I suppose that saving the world comes first.
I'm so glad that my work with the Blight bombs was useful to you. I always knew that science could save the world.
Eh? The old man? I'd agree he was a great inspiration.\n\nTake this as my token, I'm sure he would appreciate the cleverness of my choice.
This one fights to impress a lover, while that one fights to settle a grudge…\n\nDreams, honing themselves on one another… this is why battle is the currency of life.
It's possible you have heard of me? I have some renown as a musician, among other things.\n\nHere, I've come to fight and grow, and to watch others do the same.

As you've seen, the competition is simple: defeat as many creatures as you can before you drop from exhaustion. \n\nThe current record holder is my beloved Yrsa. She is truly a force of nature. I'm sure she'll want to meet you.
I am known for two things, my way with words, and… when words fail, my blade. \n\nThorpe and his Corrupted will get the latter. I will answer this challenge in blood!

string.speaker: Rima Bahar
string.name: RimaBahar
string.comment: after completing "The Alliance", before leaving Cutlass Keys

resources.string: This insult will not stand.

string.speaker: Rima Bahar
string.name: RimaBahar
string.comment: in the Soulwarden camp, before its destruction

resources.string: Look at all these people you convinced to come. You have quite the silver tongue, don't you?
A storm came in the shape of a woman. \n\nCorruption swirled around her like a cyclone, but she wasn't consumed by it. She commanded it.

string.speaker: Rima Bahar
string.name: RimaBahar
string.comment: if you talk to her at the Restless Shores bar

resources.string: Have you tried the ceviche here? It's delicious.
I suppose I should be glad if I surprise you. I've never wanted to do what's expected of me. \n\nThe truth is, somehow, fighting for the sake of fighting has lost its thrill.
The path seems clear, then - time to head to Edengrove. \n\nI believe Dr. Theo here also plans to head that way. Keeps mumbling about Blight.

string.speaker: Rima Bahar
string.name: RimaBahar
string.comment: if you talk to her at Mountainhome

resources.string: Hello there, {playerName}. Come to see which of us can kill the most Corrupted? \n\nI warn you, my record is going to be hard to beat.
I’m thinking of joining the Soulwardens. Something about their grim determination is very inspiring. \n\nMaybe now that the Tempest is gone, they'll have a little more time for fun.

the blight comes creeping swallowing the green 

our sacred charge the motherwell will rot 

so you come not to offer us your war

but share our own?

one final element is needed now 

to give our recipe the spice it needs 

to cloud Corruption's fleet in blighted spores 

the dryad's seeds
well done human
(the dryad makes a sound like wind whispering through leaves.)

string.speaker: Shamaness Ixia
string.name: ShamanessIxia
string.comment: after "The Box" and before "Recipe for Failure"

resources.string: so loud on sacred land your footsteps fall \n\nbut current needs outweigh old protocol
a human worth our trust is hard to find \n\nbut you're a fine example of your kind
(bear noises)

string.speaker: Juice the Bear
string.name: JuiceTheBear
string.comment: after "The Box" and before "Blessings of Earth"

resources.string: Oh wow, a human. Have you come to make an offering? I miss those.
Come back anytime! But not too much.
(wolf noises)

string.speaker: Snap the Wolf
string.name: SnapTheWolf
string.comment: after "The Box" and before "Blessings of Earth"

resources.string: I haven't talked to a human since the ice went away. What should I say? \n\nUm, warm weather we're having, aren't we?
Normally, I'd try to kill you. Luckily, I like you.
(wolf noises)
Normally I'd never turn to a human for help. Very few of them can be trusted. \n\nBut swift action is needed, and I understand you are good at that.
So many questions. So very human. \n\nWe can chat later, once the storm has passed.
(bear noises)
See that volcano? That's the Shattered Mountain itself. \n\nIt's always been active, but it only started erupting a little while ago.
Grr. Roar. Bear noises. \n\nOh wait, it's you. Hello again.
Hey, great job taking down the Tempest. Things are feeling a lot less tense around here.
Keep your voice down. You want them to find us?
I'm damn glad you're here, {playerName}. Yonas says you're the best among us.\n\nMakes me feel like I at least have a fighting chance if the Corrupted close in.

string.speaker: Warden Scout Titus
string.name: WardenScoutTitus
string.comment: leading into Master of the Tempest - Solo

resources.string: Y'know {playerName} - There might be another way. A way to get Thorpe out of his cozy lair and take him on one on one.\n\nThink you could take that monster in single combat?
{playerName} are you sure? It's such a brash move... The idea has been nagging at me that perhaps there's another way.
Somehow, I have the sinking feeling that we're not done.\n\nIn fact, a messenger came with reports of a new Corruption surge in Great Cleave.

I heard about the Tempest destroying the Soulwarden camp. I guess even an enemy as powerful as Thorpe doesn't represent Corruption's true strength. \n\nBut we can't give up. Our fallen friends would never forgive us.
I heard the news, but I didn't believe it. You really destroyed the Tempest? \n\nIncredible. Maybe our long nightmare is finally over!
Hey there. Always nice to see a friendly face out here. \n\nIf there's anything you need, just ask.
Now I can avoid accidentally stepping on those field researchers…because they reek of bear urine.
Hello! I'd love to chat, but the bears might overhear.
Every time I don't get eaten by a bear, I'll think of you.
Where's Theo with that bear repellent? Did he get distracted again?
Now I can finally concentrate on my work.
Oh boy, I must have pissed off someone at headquarters to get this assignment.
Thanks for the urine, I guess.
Have you seen any bears? Did they say anything about me?
It's probably for the best that the bears and I don't become best friends… \n\nGotta keep a professional distance.
Y'know, I've wandered lifetimes looking for some kind of purpose.\n\nThank providence I stumbled across this place, and these people!
Commander Yonas really gets me pumped. Have you heard the man speak?\n\nI can't wait to see some real action.
Have you studied the way pockets of Corruption erupt across the isle?\n\nThere is a pattern to it all. I'm sure of it!
Samir is a boastful oaf.\n\nI will mourn him most when the inevitable takes him.
Eliza, my good friend. Do not fear the ruddy horizon.\n\nLet the Tempest rage, when it arrives here I, Samir, will put an end to it.
You finally find a home worth having only to see it ripped away by some trespassing bastards.\n\nThat is the refrain on this damn island.
Who are you? You have a dangerous look about you. If you think I’ll be easy prey, you’re sadly mistaken. \n\nGo ahead - make your move!
Be careful where you step if you're out towards Stonereach Keep again.\n\nMy snares have a bite to 'em that'll haunt you for the rest of your days.
I beseech anyone finding this note to see it delivered to Survivalist Riches in the First Light Settlement! \n\nI fear my scouting mission has failed and my capture by the enemy is imminent.
(This memorializes the strength, and ultimately the sacrifice made by Yonas Alazar, Soulwarden)
(This memorializes the strength, and ultimately the sacrifice made by Yonas Alazar, Soulwarden)
(Thorpe lies cold. Beyond death, yet nowhere near alive.)
